WRITING.TITLE: Photoshop and Office...that's it, hopefully light/smallish for travel. USA/USD
WRITING.TEXT:
I travel a lot and want to still be able to use Photoshop and Word/Excel. That is literally it. I'd like a smaller/lighter computer and as cheap as possible as this is just my road machine. Any suggestions? Thanks in advance.
EDIT: form below
**LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE**
* Country of purchase: USA
* Budget range: As cheap as I can as this is a secondary/travel machine. Maybe $500 max (if even possible)
* Purpose (netbook, ultraportable, mainstream, gaming, desktop replacement, etc.): Traveling with Photoshop and Office only
* Screen size preference: N/A
* OS preference (Windows/Mac/Linux): Windows probably
* Gaming requirements (example games and desired fps/settings): N/A
* Other performance requirements (video editing, CAD, etc.): Just run Photoshop without freezing
* Brand preferences and reasons (already owned accessories, familiarity, business compatibility): N/A
* Any particular style that you like (examples are great): N//A
**Which of the following qualities would you prefer? (Choose one, two, or balanced)**
* Long battery life -vs- Low weight -vs- High performance: Low weight
* Build quality -vs- Low price -vs- High performance: Low price
* Low noise/heat -vs- High performance: High performance
**Which features would you pay a premium for?**
* High resolution screen: N/A
* A great keyboard: N/A
* A great touchpad/mouse buttons: N/A
* Great audio: N/A
**List any features that are critical:** Just need Photoshop and Office to run well. Everything else is not necessary
Thanks! I just need to get dj vu back on floppy disk and I'm golden!

I'm 5'8" and in the beginning (a year ago) I lost about 12 lbs just from the exercise, but I haven't lost for a few months. It's good to maintain, but I still have flab and I'm not a disciplined eater

WRITING.TITLE: So...uh, can I eat more?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've found that I can eat about 1,900 calories/day based on age weight lifestyle etc. I work out 6x/week burning about 700-800 calories per time. I'm trying to lose about 10 lbs belly fat and tone up (details below), Does this mean I can eat 2,600 calories or do I stick to the 1,900 total? Sorry if this has been asked I can't find a good answer.
Info: 29 M 145lbs workouts 6x/week are 30 min run (3.5 miles) and 30 min walk at 15% incline. Also basketball 1x/week, shooting baskets 3x/week, weights 2-3x/week.
Trying to get more tone and less belly flab
Thanks for any insight
